ch.nolix.element.GUI

Class GUI<G extends GUI<G>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.core.entity.Entity<E>
      • ch.nolix.element.core.Element<MU>
        • ch.nolix.element.core.MutableElement<ONE>
          • ch.nolix.element.bases.OptionalNamableElement<CE>
            • ch.nolix.element.bases.ConfigurableElement<CE>
              • ch.nolix.element.configurationElement.ConfigurationElement<G>
                • ch.nolix.element.GUI.GUI<G>
  • Type Parameters:
    G - The type of a GUI.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IController, Castable, IFluentObject<G>, ISmartObject<G>, Listable<G>, TypeRequestable, Clearable<G>, Closable, IRequestableContainer, Namable<G>, Named, OptionalNamable<G>, OptionalTokenable<G>, Refreshable, Resettable<G>, Tokenable<G>, Tokened, Configurable<G>, Specifiable<G>, Specified, IGUI<G>, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Frame

    public abstract class GUI<G extends GUI<G>>
extends ConfigurationElement<G>
implements IGUI<G>
    A GUI is clearable. A GUI is closable. A GUI is configurable. A GUI is refreshable.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss

      • noteMouseWheelRotationSteps

        public final void noteMouseWheelRotationSteps(int mouseWheelRotationSteps)
        Lets this GUI note the given mouse wheel rotation steps. The given number of mouse wheel rotation steps is positive if the mouse wheel was rotated forward. The given number mouse wheel rotation steps is negative if the mouse wheel was rotated backward.
        Parameters:
        rotationSteps -
